question: A point object is moving at a constant speed of <katex>$1ms^{-1}$</katex> along the principal axis of a convex lens of focal length 10cm. The speed of the image is also <katex>$1ms^{-1}$</katex>, when the object is at cm from the optic centre of the lens.
explanation: Longitudinal magnification formula for speed: <katex>$v_{image} = m^2 v_{object}$</katex>.
For a real object and real image in a convex lens, <katex>$m = -1$</katex>.
Magnification <katex>$m = -1$</katex> occurs when the object is at <katex>$2f$</katex>.
